clumpy.integer.empirical_distribution_function¶

clumpy.integer.empirical_distribution_function(X)[source]¶

Empirical distribution function of the samples X.

For now, works only for one-features values.

\[F_n(x) = \cfrac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^n \mathbf{1}_{x_i \le x}\]

where \(\mathbf{1}_{A}\) is the indicator of the event \(A\).

See Wikipedia.

Parameters

X (array-like of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – The samples to determine the empirical distribution function

Returns

F_n – The empirical distribution values for each samples.

Return type

array-like of shape (n_samples)

Previous topic

clumpy.metrics.under_sampling_log_scorer

Next topic

clumpy.integer.cumulative_distribution_function
